sentences.chinese: 25年间，达尔文收集了大量证据来支持自己的理论。

sentences.english: an automatic gearbox

trouble or difficulty

sentences.chinese: 医生必须对病人的病历完全保密。

name: constitute

name: convention

sentences.english: the city’s new convention center
sentences.chinese: 该市新建的会议中心

sentences.english: a convention for science fiction fans

name: correspond

name: craft

sentences.english: traditional rural crafts
sentences.chinese: 传统的乡村手工艺

name: criterion

sentences.chinese: 穿衣打扮是我们每天必做的事情。

sentences.english: You mustn’t worry. These are just routine enquiries.
sentences.chinese: 你不必担心，这只是例行的询问。

detailed_translations.english: the usual order in which you do things, or the things you regularly do
happening as a normal part of a job or process

name: sail
trans: vi. 航行；启航，开船; n. 帆，篷；航行; vt. 航行 时 态: sailed, sailing, sails

sentences.english: a yacht with white sails
sentences.chinese: 扬着白帆的游艇

sentences.chinese: 那只拖网渔船已经从泽布吕赫港启航。

detailed_translations.english: a large piece of strong cloth fixed onto a boat, so that the wind will push the boat along
to travel on or across an area of water in a boat or ship

name: salespeople
trans: n. 售货员,店员

name: scarce
trans: adj. 缺乏的, 罕见的比较级: scarcer, scarcest

sentences.english: Food was often scarce in the winter.
sentences.chinese: 冬季常常粮食短缺。

sentences.english: There was fierce competition for the scarce resources .
sentences.chinese: 对这些紧缺资源的争夺非常激烈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺乏的， 不足的； 稀少的， 罕见的
detailed_translations.english: if something is scarce, there is not very much of it available

name: scholar
trans: n. 学者；奖学金获得者

sentences.english: a Shakespearean scholar
sentences.chinese: 研究莎士比亚的学者

detailed_translations.english: someone who knows a lot about a particular subject, especially one that is not a science subject

name: semantic
trans: adj. 语义的；语义学的

sentences.english: He did not want to enter into a semantic debate.
sentences.chinese: 他不想卷入一场关于语义的争论。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the meanings of words

name: serial
trans: adj. 连续的；连载的；分期偿还的; n. 连载小说；电视连续剧；期刊 副 词: serially

sentences.english: Keep the questions in the same serial order .
sentences.chinese: 让这些问题保持原来的顺序。

detailed_translations.chinese: 连续的；连载的；分期偿还的
detailed_translations.english: arranged or happening one after the other in the correct order

detailed_translations.chinese: 电视连续剧；[图情] 期刊；连载小说
detailed_translations.english: a story that is broadcast or printed in several separate parts on television, in a magazine etc

name: shatter
trans: vt. 打碎；破掉；使散开；粉碎；破坏; vi. 粉碎；损坏；落叶; n. 碎片；乱七八糟的状态 时 态: shattered, shattering, shatters

sentences.english: The explosion shattered the building.
sentences.chinese: 这次爆炸把大楼炸成一片废墟。

sentences.english: A tragic accident shattered her dreams of Olympic glory.
sentences.chinese: 一场不幸的意外事故使她获得奥运奖牌的梦想破灭了。

detailed_translations.english: to break suddenly into very small pieces, or to make something break in this way

name: shelf
trans: n. 搁板；架子；搁板状物 名 词: shelfful

sentences.english: shelves of books
sentences.chinese: 一层层书架的书

sentences.english: supermarket shelves
sentences.chinese: 超级市场的货架

sentences.english: the amount of shelf space available
sentences.chinese: 可用的货架空间

detailed_translations.english: a long flat narrow board attached to a wall or in a frame or cupboard, used for putting things on

name: silt
trans: n. 淤泥，泥沙；煤粉；残渣; vi. 淤塞，充塞；为淤泥堵塞; vt. 使淤塞；充塞 时 态: silted, silting, silts 名 词: siltatio...

sentences.english: The lake was almost solid with silt and vegetation.
sentences.chinese: 这个湖几乎填满了泥沙和植被。

detailed_translations.english: sand, mud, soil etc that is carried in water and then settles at a bend in a river, an entrance to a port etc

name: soar
trans: vi. 高飞, 翱翔; 猛增; 高耸, 屹立 时 态: soared, soaring, soars 名 词: soarer

sentences.chinese: 她的体温骤然升高。

sentences.english: The price of petrol has soared in recent weeks.
sentences.chinese: 最近几个星期汽油价格猛涨。

sentences.english: soaring unemployment

detailed_translations.english: to increase quickly to a high level

name: split
trans: vt. 劈开；分离；使分离；离开; vi. 被劈开；断绝关系；离开; n. 裂缝；劈开; adj. 劈开的 Split斯普利特时 态: split, splitting, sp...

sentences.english: The branch split under their weight.
sentences.chinese: 树枝承受不住他们的重量断裂了。

sentences.english: In a severe gale the ship split in two.
sentences.chinese: 在一次强劲的大风中那艘船断成了两半。

sentences.english: If the chicken is fairly small, you may simply split it in half.
sentences.chinese: 要是鸡不太大，你把它分成两半就行。

detailed_translations.english: to divide or separate something into different parts or groups, or to be divided into different parts or groups
If something splits or if you split it, it is divided into two or more parts

name: squash
trans: vt. 将压扁，压烂，挤碎; 将向某方挤; 粗暴地使住嘴; 挤进; 平定；镇压；制服; n. 拥挤的人群; 果汁汽水; 墙网球，壁球 时 态: squashed，squashing，s...

sentences.english: Her suggestions were always squashed.
sentences.chinese: 她的建 议总是受到压制。

detailed_translations.english: to use your power or authority to stop something

detailed_translations.chinese: 壁球；挤压；咯吱声；南瓜属植物；（英）果汁饮料
detailed_translations.english: a game played by two people who use  rackets  to hit a small rubber ball against the walls of a square court

name: squeeze
trans: vt. & vi. 挤, 榨, 捏; vt. 榨取, 挤出; n. 挤, 榨, 捏; 亲切的拥抱或握手; 拥挤, 积压; 缺乏钱或时间等所引致的困难或困苦, 拮据, 短缺 时 态: s...

sentences.chinese: 他捏了捏她的手，她笑了。

sentences.english: He squeezed the trigger, but nothing happened.
sentences.chinese: 他扣动扳机，但没有反应。

detailed_translations.english: to press something firmly together with your fingers or hand

detailed_translations.chinese: 挤； 握手； 拮据， 紧缺

name: stack
trans: n. 一叠，一摞，一堆; 大量；许多；一大堆; 大烟囱; 书库; 堆栈; v. 放成整齐的一叠; 使成叠地放在…；使码放在…; 分层盘旋等待着陆; 在安插; 情况对…不利 时 态: ...

sentences.english: stacks of dirty dishes
sentences.chinese: 一摞摞脏盘子

sentences.chinese: 卡提亚夫人当时正在把干净的瓶子堆放到板条箱里。

detailed_translations.english: a neat pile of things
If you stack a number of things, you arrange them in neat piles

trans: n. 胃；胃口；腹部; vt. 忍受；吃下; vi. 忍受 时 态: stomached, stomaching, stomachs

sentences.chinese: 我饿得胃都痛了。

sentences.english: His stomach was full of food.
sentences.chinese: 他的胃里塞满了食物。

detailed_translations.english: the organ inside your body where food begins to be  digested

name: straightforward
trans: adj. 正直的，坦率的；老实的; 简单的；易懂的 副 词: straightforwardly 名 词: straightforwardness 副 词: strai...

sentences.english: In this example, we will use the most straightforward method of all -- writing our object reference to a file that will be picked up by our client.
sentences.chinese: 在这个示例中，我们将使用所有方法中最直截了当的一种 — 将对象引用写入一个文件，该 文件将由客户机选取。

name: strain
trans: n. 张力；拉紧；负担；扭伤；血缘 vi. 拉紧；尽力 vt. 拉紧；滥用；滤去；竭力 时 态: strained，straining，strains

sentences.english: I’ve strained a muscle in my leg.
sentences.chinese: 我的腿有一处肌肉拉伤。

sentences.english: You’ll strain your eyes trying to read in this light.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的光线下看书会伤眼睛的。

trans: adj. 突然的，意外的；快速的; n. 突然发生的事 副 词: suddenly 名 词: suddenness

sentences.chinese: 天气的突然变化

sentences.english: Life is cruel, she thought, with a sudden rush of anger.
sentences.chinese: 生活真残酷，她想，心头突然涌上一股怒气。

sentences.english: a sudden movement
sentences.chinese: 突然的一动

sentences.english: Her death was sudden.
sentences.chinese: 她的死很突然。

name: sufferer
trans: n. 受害者；受难者; 患病者

name: surge
trans: n. 洋溢, 奔放; 浪涛般汹涌奔腾; vi. 蜂拥而出; 洋溢, 奔放; 汹涌, 奔腾 时 态: surged, surging, surges

sentences.english: a device that protects your computer against electrical surges
sentences.chinese: 一台计算机电涌保护设备

detailed_translations.chinese: 汹涌；大浪，波涛；汹涌澎湃；巨涌

if a feeling surges or surges up, you begin to feel it very strongly

name: sustain

sentences.chinese: 他重重地靠在她身上，让她几乎撑不住了。

sentences.english: Which planets can sustain life?
sentences.chinese: 哪些行星可以维持生命的存在？

detailed_translations.english: to hold up the weight of something

name: symptom
trans: n. 征兆；症状

sentences.chinese: 精神分裂症最常见的症状之一是幻听。

detailed_translations.english: something wrong with your body or mind which shows that you have a particular illness

name: tackle
trans: vt. 解决；应付; vt. & vi. 捉住；扭倒; n. 拦截；擒抱; 器具，器械，用具; 滑车，滑轮组 时 态: tackled，tackling，tackles 名 词:...

sentences.english: There is more than one way to tackle the problem.
sentences.chinese: 解决这个问题不止一个办法。

sentences.chinese: 这次经历的实质是什么？

sentences.chinese: 把表土倒在这里。

sentences.chinese: 石头是基础，上面是泥土，再上面是表土。

sentences.chinese: 这位老人回想着自己过去的生活， 神情恍惚。

sentences.chinese: 很明显，她的头和她的面目安详沉静：她似乎在那儿发怔出神，眼睛睁得大大的，但是却看不见。

sentences.english: Having fallen into a trance state, they acted in accordance with these supernaturalist beliefs: dancing wildly for days on end.

name: transmit

sentences.chinese: 美国公开赛将通过卫星现场直播。

sentences.english: The system transmits information over digital phone lines.
sentences.chinese: 这一系统通过数字电话线路传输信息。

detailed_translations.english: to send an electronic signal, radio or television broadcast, etc.

name: transparent
trans: adj. 透明的; 含义清楚的, 显而易见的 副 词: transparently

sentences.english: a transparent plastic container
sentences.chinese: 透明的塑料容器

sentences.english: Am I that transparent (= are my intentions that obvious) ?
sentences.chinese: 我就那么没有城府？

detailed_translations.english: allowing you to see through it

name: triple

sentences.chinese: 对一宗三重谋杀案的调查

sentences.chinese: 三部恐怖电影的连续放映

sentences.chinese: 三连冠世界冠军

sentences.english: a triple bypass heart operation
sentences.chinese: 三重心脏搭桥手术

name: tune
trans: n. 曲调, 曲子; vt. & vi. 调音; vt. 调整 时 态: tuned, tuning, tunes

sentences.chinese: 那曲调很美。

sentences.chinese: 她唱了几首经典老歌和一些新曲。

sentences.english: Someone’s coming tomorrow to tune the piano.
sentences.chinese: 明天有人来给钢琴调音。

name: ultimate
trans: adj. 最后的，最终的；终极的；极端的；最好的；根本的；基本的；基础性的; n. 最好的事物；精华；极致；极限；最高典范

sentences.english: The ultimate outcome of the experiment cannot be predicted.
sentences.chinese: 试验的最后结果无法预测。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s ultimate aim is their main and most important aim, that they hope to achieve in the future

name: unbiased
trans: adj. 无偏见的；公正的 名 词: unbiasedness

sentences.english: We aim to provide a service that is balanced and unbiased.
sentences.chinese: 我们的目标是提供一种公平公正的服务。

sentences.chinese: 一名公正的观察员

name: undergo
trans: vt. 经历，经受；忍受 时 态: underwent undergone undergoing, undergoes

sentences.chinese: 这个国家最近经历了巨大的变化。

sentences.english: He has been released from prison to undergo medical treatment in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 他获释出狱去美国接受治疗。

sentences.english: She has been undergoing tests since Monday.
sentences.chinese: 她从星期一开始一直在接受各种检查。

sentences.english: Teachers should be expected to undergo mid-career training and development.
sentences.chinese: 教师应该参加中期职业培训和发展活动。

detailed_translations.english: if you undergo a change, an unpleasant experience etc, it happens to you or is done to you

name: undermine

sentences.chinese: 可能会损害医疗保健制度的经济政策

detailed_translations.english: to gradually make someone or something less strong or effective

name: unprecedented
trans: adj. 前所未有的, 无前例的副 词: unprecedentedly

sentences.english: Such a move is rare, but not unprecedented.
sentences.chinese: 这样的举动少见，但并非从来没有过。

detailed_translations.english: If something is unprecedented, it has never happened before

name: update
trans: vt. 更新；校正，修正；使现代化; n. 更新；现代化 时 态: updated, updating, updates

sentences.english: The files need updating.
sentences.chinese: 这些档案需要更新。

detailed_translations.english: to add the most recent information to something
the most recent news or information about something

name: utilise
trans: vt. 利用；使用

sentences.chinese: 有一件事从来没有穿过我们精英的头脑，那就是利用本地人才，本地企业，本地资金来建设巴基斯坦。

sentences.english: Another benefit is that learning software can utilise all three learning techniques of hearing, seeing and doing which greatly reinforces acquisition.
sentences.chinese: 另一个好处是，学习软件可以利用看、听、做三种学习方式，加强学生对知识的理解和掌握。

name: viable
trans: adj. 能养活的；能生育的；可行的 名 词: viability

sentences.english: viable seeds
sentences.chinese: 可存活的种子

detailed_translations.chinese: 可行的；能养活的；能生育的
detailed_translations.english: a viable idea, plan, or method can work successfully

name: vigilance
trans: n. 警觉;警惕;警戒; 失眠症;惊醒症

sentences.english: the need for increased police vigilance
sentences.chinese: 警方加强警戒的必要性

detailed_translations.english: careful attention that you give to what is happening, so that you will notice any danger or illegal activity

name: violence
trans: n. 激烈；暴力；侵犯；歪曲

sentences.english: There is too much sex and violence on TV these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今电视上性爱和暴力场面太多。

detailed_translations.english: behaviour that is intended to hurt other people physically

name: weave
trans: vt. & vi. 编，织；织成; vt. 编排，杜撰 时 态: wove woven weaving，weaves

sentences.english: hand-woven scarves
sentences.chinese: 手织围巾

sentences.english: Only a few of the women still weave.
sentences.chinese: 只有数量很少的妇女还在编织。

sentences.english: traditional basket weaving
sentences.chinese: 传统的编篮技术

detailed_translations.chinese: 迂回行进；编织；编造，编纂
detailed_translations.english: to make cloth, a carpet, a basket etc by crossing threads or thin pieces under and over each other by hand or on a loom

name: wreck
trans: n. 失事；残骸；破坏；失去健康的人; vt. 破坏；使失事；拆毁; vi. 失事；营救失事船只 时 态: wrecked, wrecking, wrecks

sentences.english: Divers discovered the wreck of an old German warship.
sentences.chinese: 潜水员发现了一艘沉没的德国旧军舰。

sentences.english: Injury threatened to wreck his sporting career.
sentences.chinese: 伤病可能会毁了他的运动生涯。

detailed_translations.english: a ship that has sunk
to completely spoil something so that it cannot continue in a successful way

name: yacht
trans: n. 快艇, 帆船, 游艇时 态: yachted, yachting, yachts

sentences.english: His 36 ft yacht sank suddenly last summer.
sentences.chinese: 他的36英尺游艇去年夏天突然沉没了。

detailed_translations.english: a large boat with a sail, used for pleasure or sport, especially one that has a place where you can sleep
